newsitem.title: USA: Muni volume jumps 20 pct through September - SDC.
newsitem.headline: Muni volume jumps 20 pct through September - SDC.

text.p: Municipal bond issuers sold a total of $125.5 billion of debt in the first nine months of 1996, a 20 percent increase over the $104.6 billion in the same period of 1995, Securities Data Co said on Monday.

Goldman Sachs & Co was the top-ranked municipal bond underwriter for the period, acting as senior manager on $15.4 billion of debt, compared with $13 billion underwritten by second-ranked Smith Barney Inc, a unit of Travelers Group Inc.
Merrill Lynch & Co Inc ranked third, with $12.4 billion to its credit.
For the third quarter alone, municipal bond issuers sold a total of $36 billion of debt, virtually unchanged from the same period last year, Securities Data said.

Smith Barney was the top ranked underwriter of municipal bonds for the third quarter, senior managing nearly $4.5 billion of bonds compared to $3.9 billion for second-ranked Goldman Sachs & Co., Securities Data said.
Smith Barney ranked second for the quarter last year, with almost $3.9 billion of volume. Merrill Lynch, which ranked first for the quarter last year, fell to third in the 1996 quarterly rankings.
Orrick Herrington & Sutcliffe was the top bond counsel for the first three quarters of 1996, working on almost $11 billion of debt.

Public Financial Management ranked first among financial advisers, with 190 issues totaling $7.5 billion to its credit. Public Resources Advisory Group was second at $5.6 billion, followed by First Southwest Co at $4.1 billion.
